text: if you've watched TV at all recently you
may have seen this ad for a game called
destiny good no I'm never remember you
babe destiny for those who don't know it
is a massive multiplayer online shooter
with about 20 million registered users
but people quickly stop playing it
mostly because it lacked an story and it
involved way too much busy work but
whether you were one of those 20 million
people over just curious about the game
now is the best time ever to jump into
the game destiny
when destiny launched in 2014 it was
mainly critiqued for its lack of
compelling narrative maybe that's why
you stopped playing a year ago cut
scenes for sparse interesting backstory
was locked behind text-based cards and
characters were never really fully
developed you're alive the good news is
that destiny has done a full 180 with
its new expansion pack the taken King
mainly with character development we
need a warlock inside the dread-nots
here we go our first priority must be to
protect the city the news story is full
of smart quirky dialogue from characters
that were never really developed beyond
just text on screen you know you're a
true artist can't even see the doing
while this doesn't fix the issues with
the original story this is a breath of
fresh air for the franchise for those of
you that have already purchased destiny
there's a lot waiting for you if you
jump back in with the taken King there
are brand new missions three new strikes
a whole new world for you to explore and
a lot more on top of that you'll receive
free rewards from almost every vendor by
starting the mission the veterans tour
for those of you that didn't buy the
game when it first came out don't feel
left out your patience has now been
rewarded by getting a hundred and forty
dollars worth of content for just a mere
60 dollars there was nothing more
frustrating than trying to level up in
the original destiny a year ago since
the game has a randomized loot system
that doles out rewards based on
algorithms your level was determined by
luck and waiting rather than skill and
hard work fortunately the taken King has
completely overhauled its leveling
system now your level is based off of
just playing the game and earning
experience despite all of its initial
flaws the developers have been fixing
and improving the game over the past
year more than anything else that's
probably the biggest reason why you
should give destiny another shot the
taken king is just another example of
the ever-evolving ecosystem that is
you
